subject: History
title: Disease and Depopulation
description: A fast breakdown of Disease and Depopulation for builders.

hook.text: European explorers' deadliest export wasn't guns or religion. It was their breath.

buildup.text: Indigenous peoples had no immunity to smallpox, measles, or influenza. First contact was a death sentence.

discovery.text: In the Americas, up to 90% of the Indigenous population died within 100 years of European arrival.

twist.text: The population collapse was so massive it may have caused global coolingâ€”abandoned farmland regrew as forests.

climax.text: Disease did more to shape the post-Columbian world than any battle, treaty, or explorer combined.

punchline.text: Germs conquered more territory than any army.

quiz.question: What unexpected climate effect may have resulted from massive Indigenous depopulation?
options: Global cooling as abandoned farmland regrew as forests
Rising sea levels from disrupted river systems
